content: I am 16 and have always been fascinated by the military but lately I have seen new interesting opportunities. I was watching the military channel and there were soldiers disarming IEDs' in some heavily armored vehicle. I would like to know anything and everthing about this job.How do I get into this job?What is required? Any and all info is appreciated.
reply: I am 16 and have always been fascinated by the military but lately I have seen new interesting opportunities. I was watching the military channel and there were soldiers disarming IEDs' in some heavily armored vehicle. I would like to know anything and everthing about this job.How do I get into this job?What is required? Any and all info is appreciated.
title: Job: Disarming Bombs

content: All of the uniformed services have EOD (explosive ordinance disposal) units and they have the same/similar training with the exception of the Navy. The Navy adds dive school to the pipeline. If you want to know more look into EOD or search each individual branch and then look up EOD on their site. There is more than enough info on the web that there is no need to elaborate here.
reply: All of the uniformed services have EOD (explosive ordinance disposal) units and they have the same/similar training with the exception of the Navy. The Navy adds dive school to the pipeline. If you want to know more look into EOD or search each individual branch and then look up EOD on their site. There is more than enough info on the web that there is no need to elaborate here.

reply: we have an nco here who has asked me more than once if i was interested in eod. i asked if they offer classes on how to eat with a hook ? he said no. so i said no thank you.
title: Job: Disarming Bombs

content: Worked with a lot of explosives back in the 70s - set up by ME.....and that was scary enough at times! What really "bugs" me is that anyone would want to get close to someone else's explosives - specifically set up to blow THEM up - ! That is one of the very good uses of a tank cannon at 100 meters plus! Actually, I did a little EOD (Destroying faulty/out-dated/un-exploded munitions and demolitions) at Ft. Knox and with the Army Guard in Utah... It is a necessary job, but very dangerous, and not one to be sought as a "joy ride." The "occupation" can go all the way to the top rung, which deals with disarming nuclear weapons, in the case of aircraft crashes or missile mishaps involving nuclear warheads... Thank goodness, there haven't been any of those in a lot of years - - There are regular tech schools for all of them, but as I hinted at the top, some of the things I've seen EOD teams doing in Iraq and Afghanistan in proximity to IEDs just doesn't make sense to me, especially with the sophistication that could be built into a device today... A young Air Force troop from Utah was killed within the last few years while trying to disarm a car bomb. What are they teaching theses poeple??? I just had to shake my head. It's a war zone!! I'd back off 1-200 Meters and shoot the thing to pieces with non-explosive rounds. Many times, that will tear an expedient bomb apart without detonating it - - Oh well - - Make sure ya have the max life insurance if you decide to pursue your dreams. Make it out to yer mom, and send the policy to her with a lock of yer hair, because if you make a mistake, that's all she'll get back of ya - - Wandering and Wondering
reply: Worked with a lot of explosives back in the 70s - set up by ME.....and that was scary enough at times! content: If you are thinking of going EOD," God only knows why you would" you must have a steady hand and calm as a rock. If you study all the time, even after you get into it you have a good chance of a great job. If you are a drinker or anything that will take your mind off the job, then do something else. Good luck with your choice if you go with EOD. MD

content: quote: Originally posted by Vicdude: I've noticed a fair number of new members just asking a question in their first and the general tone in each seems to be very similar. One cannot help but wonder if it's the same dude each time. Quite possible that the interloper is a member in long standing. I have noticed and stated that such a thing might be going on. If the person is smart enough they have a roving IP and can change the style of writing to make it look like more than one gum-chewing pimple-faced, kid with way too much technology on his/her hands. Also there is the possibility that the interloper is a writer who has failed at previous attempts to entice members to relate stories for their benefits in some novel, or script they are writing. Come back as a kid wanting to know just what they might expect in the near future. Averages and the bell curve and knowing what that is all about can tell you that some types of posts/events occur with a genuine frequency. Yet there are times that the frequency of some types of events/posts changes radically and then it leaves me to wonder why that change occurred. I see people giving information freely depending on how they perceive the visitor and there are some factors that almost guarantee an "In" with the targeted audience. So a person can come in here and learn what things work and don't work for the members here and then use that to gain whatever information they want. I always want to know more about an individual before I relate anything to them, Sometimes I have found myself disarmed to the point of just about telling them something I shouldn't. I think that's probably why one shouldn't drink to excess when surfing the web or even get loaded up on sleeping pills and post a notion on MDC. Leaves the other members wondering, What the he11 you said?. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

title: Job: Disarming Bombs

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: Actually, I did a little EOD (Destroying faulty/out-dated/un-exploded munitions and demolitions) at Ft. Knox and with the Army Guard in Utah... It is a necessary job, but very dangerous, and not one to be sought as a "joy ride." The "occupation" can go all the way to the top rung, which deals with disarming nuclear weapons, in the case of aircraft crashes or missile mishaps involving nuclear warheads... Thank goodness, there haven't been any of those in a lot of years - - Did the same at Holloman. Not my favorite time in service. It's a war zone!! I'd back off 1-200 Meters and shoot the thing to pieces with non-explosive rounds. Many times, that will tear an expedient bomb apart without detonating it - - Oh well - - They have a new water cannon type device that injects water at high speed into the casing of the suspected bomb. Saves a lot of lives when used properly. I would rather have a job Disarming Blondes. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?
quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: Actually, I did a little EOD (Destroying faulty/out-dated/un-exploded munitions and demolitions) at Ft. Knox and with the Army Guard in Utah... content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: .....some of the things I've seen EOD teams doing in Iraq and Afghanistan in proximity to IEDs just doesn't make sense to me, especially with the sophistication that could be built into a device today... A young Air Force troop from Utah was killed within the last few years while trying to disarm a car bomb. What are they teaching theses poeple??? I just had to shake my head. It's a war zone!! I'd back off 1-200 Meters and shoot the thing to pieces with non-explosive rounds. Many times, that will tear an expedient bomb apart without detonating it - - Oh well - - .....please refrain from being a Monday morning quarterback on something you do not know all the facts about......FYI: fancy equipment doesn't always work too well in +120 degree heat and sand, but the job still has to get done....

content: quote: Originally posted by Vicdude: I've noticed a fair number of new members just asking a question in their first and the general tone in each seems to be very similar. One cannot help but wonder if it's the same dude each time. Quite possible that the interloper is a member in long standing. I have noticed and stated that such a thing might be going on. If the person is smart enough they have a roving IP and can change the style of writing to make it look like more than one gum-chewing pimple-faced, kid with way too much technology on his/her hands. Also there is the possibility that the interloper is a writer who has failed at previous attempts to entice members to relate stories for their benefits in some novel, or script they are writing. Come back as a kid wanting to know just what they might expect in the near future. Averages and the bell curve and knowing what that is all about can tell you that some types of posts/events occur with a genuine frequency. Yet there are times that the frequency of some types of events/posts changes radically and then it leaves me to wonder why that change occurred. I see people giving information freely depending on how they perceive the visitor and there are some factors that almost guarantee an "In" with the targeted audience. So a person can come in here and learn what things work and don't work for the members here and then use that to gain whatever information they want. I always want to know more about an individual before I relate anything to them, Sometimes I have found myself disarmed to the point of just about telling them something I shouldn't. I think that's probably why one shouldn't drink to excess when surfing the web or even get loaded up on sleeping pills and post a notion on MDC. Leaves the other members wondering, What the he11 you said?. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

I was watching the military channel and there were soldiers disarming IEDs' in some heavily armored vehicle. I would like to know anything and everthing about this job.How do I get into this job?What is required? Any and all info is appreciated.

content: All of the uniformed services have EOD (explosive ordinance disposal) units and they have the same/similar training with the exception of the Navy. The Navy adds dive school to the pipeline. If you want to know more look into EOD or search each individual branch and then look up EOD on their site. There is more than enough info on the web that there is no need to elaborate here.
reply: All of the uniformed services have EOD (explosive ordinance disposal) units and they have the same/similar training with the exception of the Navy. The Navy adds dive school to the pipeline. If you want to know more look into EOD or search each individual branch and then look up EOD on their site. There is more than enough info on the web that there is no need to elaborate here.

title: Job: Disarming Bombs

content: Worked with a lot of explosives back in the 70s - set up by ME.....and that was scary enough at times! What really "bugs" me is that anyone would want to get close to someone else's explosives - specifically set up to blow THEM up - ! That is one of the very good uses of a tank cannon at 100 meters plus! Actually, I did a little EOD (Destroying faulty/out-dated/un-exploded munitions and demolitions) at Ft. Knox and with the Army Guard in Utah... It is a necessary job, but very dangerous, and not one to be sought as a "joy ride." The "occupation" can go all the way to the top rung, which deals with disarming nuclear weapons, in the case of aircraft crashes or missile mishaps involving nuclear warheads... Thank goodness, there haven't been any of those in a lot of years - - There are regular tech schools for all of them, but as I hinted at the top, some of the things I've seen EOD teams doing in Iraq and Afghanistan in proximity to IEDs just doesn't make sense to me, especially with the sophistication that could be built into a device today... A young Air Force troop from Utah was killed within the last few years while trying to disarm a car bomb. What are they teaching theses poeple??? I just had to shake my head. It's a war zone!! I'd back off 1-200 Meters and shoot the thing to pieces with non-explosive rounds. Many times, that will tear an expedient bomb apart without detonating it - - Oh well - - Make sure ya have the max life insurance if you decide to pursue your dreams. Make it out to yer mom, and send the policy to her with a lock of yer hair, because if you make a mistake, that's all she'll get back of ya - - Wandering and Wondering
reply: Worked with a lot of explosives back in the 70s - set up by ME.....and that was scary enough at times! A young Air Force troop from Utah was killed within the last few years while trying to disarm a car bomb. What are they teaching theses poeple??? I just had to shake my head. It's a war zone!! content: If you are thinking of going EOD," God only knows why you would" you must have a steady hand and calm as a rock. If you study all the time, even after you get into it you have a good chance of a great job. If you are a drinker or anything that will take your mind off the job, then do something else. Good luck with your choice if you go with EOD. MD

I always want to know more about an individual before I relate anything to them, Sometimes I have found myself disarmed to the point of just about telling them something I shouldn't. I think that's probably why one shouldn't drink to excess when surfing the web or even get loaded up on sleeping pills and post a notion on MDC. Leaves the other members wondering, What the he11 you said?. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?
quote: Originally posted by Vicdude: I've noticed a fair number of new members just asking a question in their first and the general tone in each seems to be very similar. One cannot help but wonder if it's the same dude each time.
reply: Quite possible that the interloper is a member in long standing. I have noticed and stated that such a thing might be going on. If the person is smart enough they have a roving IP and can change the style of writing to make it look like more than one gum-chewing pimple-faced, kid with way too much technology on his/her hands. Also there is the possibility that the interloper is a writer who has failed at previous attempts to entice members to relate stories for their benefits in some novel, or script they are writing. Come back as a kid wanting to know just what they might expect in the near future. Averages and the bell curve and knowing what that is all about can tell you that some types of posts/events occur with a genuine frequency. Yet there are times that the frequency of some types of events/posts changes radically and then it leaves me to wonder why that change occurred. I see people giving information freely depending on how they perceive the visitor and there are some factors that almost guarantee an "In" with the targeted audience. So a person can come in here and learn what things work and don't work for the members here and then use that to gain whatever information they want. I always want to know more about an individual before I relate anything to them, Sometimes I have found myself disarmed to the point of just about telling them something I shouldn't. I think that's probably why one shouldn't drink to excess when surfing the web or even get loaded up on sleeping pills and post a notion on MDC. Leaves the other members wondering, What the he11 you said?. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?
title: Job: Disarming Bombs
